faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: The course includes various quantitative methods than can be exploited for solving economic problems. The following distinct topics will be covered: the formulation of problems, most relevant solution methods (graphical method, simplex method, transportation simplex method), the solution of assignments in computers (PC-s) and the analysis of obtained results.
description.et: Käsitletakse majandusprobleemide lahendamiseks kasutatavaid kvantitatiivseid meetodeid, vastavate ülesannete formuleerimist, peamisi  lahendusvõtteid (graafiline lahendusmeetod, simpleksmeetod, transpordiülesannete lahendusvõtted), ülesannete lahendamist arvutil ning saadud tulemuste analüüsi.

objectives.en: After taking the course students will have acquired both theoretical knowledge and practical experience related to the usage of mathematical models for analyzing economic problems and finding optimal plans. The are expected to able to both choose between different alternative solution methods as well as use results obtained from solving the models for making decisions in practice.
objectives.et: Ainekursuse omandamine annab üliõpilastele teadmised ja kogemused majandusprobleemide analüüsimisel, planeerimisel ja optimeerimisel kasutatavate matemaatiliste mudelite koostamisest, lahendusmeetodite valikust ja saadud lahendustulemuste alusel otsuste langetamise võimalustest.

learning_outcomes.en:
After taking the course the student has acquired the following skills and competencies
·	Knows different mathematical models and methods, and their substance
·	Is able to present the problems found in economic practice in the form of the mathematical model of the situation
·	Is able to choose the appropriate mathematical method or methods in order to solve that particular problem
·	Is able to use the chosen mathematical methods and to interpret the acquired results
·	Knows how to use the results of mathematical modelling for decision-making
learning_outcomes.et:
Tunneb erinevaid matemaatilisi mudeleid ja meetodeid ning nende olemust.
Oskab majanduspraktikas esile tulevaid probleeme esitada situatsiooni matemaatilise mudelina.
Oskab valida selle probleemi lahendamiseks sobiva(d) matemaatilise(d) meetodi(d).
Oskab valitud matemaatilisi meetodeid kasutada ja saadud tulemusi tõlgendada.
Tunneb võimalusi matemaatilise mudeli tulemuste kasutamiseks otsuste langetamisel.

independent_work.et:
Home assignment I: Data collection and presentation
Home assignment II: Linear programming
Home assignment III: Networks/transportation models
Seminar work about cases on different models
Detailed guidelines will be provided during the semester, in lectures and through study information system.

description.et:
Home assignment I about data collection and presentation.
Feedback will be provided verbally in the seminar where students present their work.

Home assignment II about linear programming. 
Feedback will be given individually via email in 14 days at the latest.

Test to cover the first half of the course. 
Feedback will be provided in 7 days by corrected tests and by discussing the questions in the lecture.

Home assignment III about networks/transport models.
Feedback will be given individually via email in 14 days at the latest.

Seminar work about cases how to apply the models.
Feedback will be given orally in the seminar.

grade_preconditions.et: Completion of home assignments and tests, collecting at least 20 points from these.

grade_evaluation.et:
Test: 10%
Home assignment I: 10%
Home assignment II: 10%
Home assignment III: 10%
Seminar work: 5%
Exam: 55%
For those submitting home assignments and taking test - in the end of semester, for the others: next year

debt_elimination.et: In agreement with a lecturer, only if has participated in studies.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials: Curwin, J. and Slater, R. Quantitative methods for business decisions. 6th edition. Cengage Learning EMEA, 2008, 790 pp.
resources.recommended_materials: Oakshott, L. Essential Quantitative Methods for Business, Management and Finance. 4th edition. Palgrave Macmillan, 2009, 510 pp.Denscombe, M. Ground Rules for Social Researh. 2nd edition. Open University Press, McGraw Hill 2010, 236 pp.

description.et: Introduction to the course, quantitative approach
Linear programming with Excel (NB! Group 1 at 08:30, Group 2 at 10:15)
Networks model, due date for home assingment II
Transportation model, due date for home assignment III
Decision making for probabilistic environments, game theory
Final seminar to discuss studied methods
